turing

Class Tape

  • java.lang.Object
    • turing.Tape

  • public class Tape
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Hunter R. Caskey Data structure representing the tape component of a Turing machine. The underlying data is modeled as a double linked list where the TapeCell class are the atomic elements of the list.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tape()
      Default constructor for a Tape object with a single blank cell.
      Tape(char[] contents)
      Constructor for a Tape object with initialized tape contents.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TapeCell currentCell()
      Get the current cell under the read/write head of the machine.
      char readCell()
      Read the contents under the read/write head of the TM.
      void shiftLeft()
      Shifts the read/write head of the TM to the left by one cell.
      void shiftRight()
      Shifts the read/write head of the TM to the right by one cell.
      java.lang.String toString(boolean showHead) 
      void writeCell(char ch)
      Set the contents under the read/write head of the TM.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tape

        public Tape()
        Default constructor for a Tape object with a single blank cell.

      • Tape

        public Tape(char[] contents)
        Constructor for a Tape object with initialized tape contents.
        Parameters:
        contents - The input string to create the Tape object with. Each character in the input string is converted to a cell.

    • Method Detail

      • currentCell

        public TapeCell currentCell()
        Get the current cell under the read/write head of the machine.
        Returns:
        The cell under the read/write head.

      • readCell

        public char readCell()
        Read the contents under the read/write head of the TM.
        Returns:
        The symbol in the TapeCell object under the read/write head of the TM.

      • writeCell

        public void writeCell(char ch)
        Set the contents under the read/write head of the TM.
        Parameters:
        ch - The new symbol to insert into the read/write head's cell.

      • shiftLeft

        public void shiftLeft()
        Shifts the read/write head of the TM to the left by one cell. If the read/write head is at the leftmost position in the tape a new cell will be created initialized to a blank 'b'.

      • shiftRight

        public void shiftRight()
        Shifts the read/write head of the TM to the right by one cell. If the read/write head is at the rightmost position in the tape a new cell will be created initialized to a blank 'b'.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(boolean showHead)
        Parameters:
        showHead - boolean indication to designate the symbol under the read/write head of the TM with '[]'.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the entire contents of the TM tape.
